recipes.name: Classic Greek Salad (Horiatiki)
recipes.description: A cornerstone of the Mediterranean diet, packed with antioxidants, healthy fats, and fiber. Recommended by doctors for heart health.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, green pepper, red onion, and olives.
Gently add the cubed feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately with whole-grain bread.

recipes.name: Lentil and Spinach Soup
recipes.description: A hearty, high-fiber soup that supports digestive health and stable blood sugar. A staple in cardiac rehab diets.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in lentils, vegetable broth, cumin, and turmeric. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Lemon & Dill
recipes.description: Rich in Omega-3 fatty acids, this dish is frequently recommended by cardiologists for reducing inflammation and improving cholesterol.
ingredients: 2 (6 oz) salmon fillets, skin-on or skinless
1 lemon, half juiced and half thinly sliced
1 tbsp fresh dill, chopped (or 1 tsp dried)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, dill, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mixture evenly over the salmon fillets.
Place lemon slices on top of the salmon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with additional lemon wedges and a side of steamed vegetables.

recipes.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Bowl
recipes.description: A complete plant-based protein source, perfect for managing weight and blood sugar. Often suggested by nutritionists for its high nutrient density.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup corn kernels (fresh, frozen, or canned)
For the dressing: 3 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp cumin, salt, pepper
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions using water or broth. Fluff with a fork and let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, bell pepper, and red onion.
In a small jar, shake together the lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Pour dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with avocado slices and lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Oatmeal with Berries and Chia Seeds
recipes.description: A powerhouse breakfast for heart health. Soluble fiber from oats helps lower LDL cholesterol, a common recommendation from doctors.
ingredients: 1 cup water or unsweetened almond milk
instructions: Combine oats and liquid in a saucepan. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Pour into a bowl. Top with berries, chia seeds, nuts, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Drizzle with honey or maple syrup if desired.

recipes.name: Chickpea and Vegetable Curry
recipes.description: A flavorful, fiber-rich plant-based curry. Chickpeas help regulate blood sugar and promote satiety, making it a doctor-favorite for weight management.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in curry powder and cook for another 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes (with their juice), chickpeas, and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer.
If using, add cauliflower. Cook for 10-15 minutes until sauce has thickened and cauliflower is tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with brown rice.

recipes.name: Herb-Grilled Chicken Breast
recipes.description: A lean protein source essential for muscle maintenance and metabolic health. This simple recipe is a go-to for doctors advocating low-fat, high-protein diets.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Pat chicken breasts dry. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
In a small bowl, mix oregano, thyme, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Rub the spice mixture evenly over both sides of the chicken breasts.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with a large side salad.

recipes.name: Avocado and White Bean Wrap
recipes.description: A quick, no-cook lunch packed with healthy fats and fiber. Dietitians often recommend this for a heart-healthy, satisfying meal on the go.
ingredients: 1 whole wheat tortilla or lavash bread
1/2 can (15 oz) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
A handful of baby spinach or arugula
instructions: Lay the tortilla flat on a plate.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the center of the tortilla.
Top with cannellini beans, spinach, carrots, and red onion.
Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
Fold the sides of the tortilla inward and roll tightly from the bottom to form a wrap.
Slice in half and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
recipes.description: A classic Asian preparation that is light, low in calories, and rich in protein. Doctors recommend steaming as a heart-healthy cooking method.
ingredients: 2 white fish fillets (like cod, tilapia, or sea bass)
instructions: Place the fish fillets on a heatproof plate that will fit inside your steamer.
Sprinkle half of the ginger and scallions over the fish.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice wine in a small bowl. Drizzle half over the fish.
Bring water in a steamer to a boil. Place the plate inside, cover, and steam for 8-10 minutes, or until fish is opaque and flakes easily.
Carefully remove the plate. Top with remaining ginger and scallions.
Heat the remaining sauce mixture and pour it over the steamed fish. Garnish with cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Turmeric Golden Milk
recipes.description: An anti-inflammatory beverage often suggested by doctors for managing arthritis and promoting overall wellness. Naturally caffeine-free.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or milk of choice
A pinch of black pepper (enhances turmeric absorption)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a small saucepan.
Whisk vigorously until no clumps remain.
Heat over medium heat until hot but not boiling, about 3-5 minutes.
Pour into a mug and enjoy warm.

recipes.name: Hearty Mushroom and Barley Soup
recipes.description: A high-fiber, low-fat soup that supports heart health and digestion. Barley is a fantastic source of beta-glucan, recommended by doctors for cholesterol management.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms have released their liquid and started to brown, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the barley, vegetable broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45-50 minutes, or until barley is tender.
Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Tabbouleh (Parsley and Bulgur Salad)
recipes.description: A refreshing Levantine salad bursting with antioxidants and fiber. Doctors praise its use of fresh herbs and whole grains for nutrient density.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped
2 tomatoes, seeds removed and finely diced
instructions: Place the bulgur in a bowl and cover with warm water. Let soak for 15-20 minutes, or until tender. Drain in a fine mesh sieve, pressing to remove excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the soaked bulgur, parsley, mint, tomatoes, and scallions.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled, scooped with romaine lettuce leaves or as a side dish.

recipes.name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic Glaze
recipes.description: A simple side dish that transforms Brussels sprouts into a sweet and savory delight. Rich in vitamins C and K, often recommended for immune and bone health.
ingredients: 1 lb (450g) Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a baking sheet, toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper until evenly coated.
Arrange in a single layer, cut-side down.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and deeply browned on the edges.
Transfer to a serving dish. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and pomegranate molasses (if using). Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chia Seed Pudding with Mango
recipes.description: A make-ahead breakfast rich in omega-3s and fiber. Doctors and nutritionists recommend chia seeds for their role in promoting satiety and digestive health.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk or coconut milk
instructions: In a jar or bowl, whisk together chia seeds, almond milk, vanilla extract, and sweetener (if using).
Let sit for 5 minutes, then whisk again to prevent clumps.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight.
Before serving, layer the pudding with diced mango in a glass.
Garnish with shredded coconut and extra mango pieces.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Tofu with Broccoli
recipes.description: A quick, plant-based stir-fry packed with protein and cruciferous vegetables. A staple in diets recommended for managing blood pressure and cholesterol.
ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Toss the cubed tofu with cornstarch until evenly coated.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until golden and crispy on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the skillet. Add broccoli and bell pepper and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, water, and sweetener.
Pour the sauce into the skillet. Add the cooked tofu back in. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats everything.
Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve immediately with brown rice.

recipes.name: Mediterranean Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipes.description: Bell peppers filled with a savory mixture of quinoa, vegetables, and herbs. A complete, balanced meal doctors love for its heart-healthy profile.
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Place the hollowed bell peppers in a baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, parsley, and mint.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Gently fold in the feta cheese if using.
Spoon the filling evenly into the bell peppers.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 30-35 minutes, until peppers are tender.
Remove foil and bake for another 5 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.name: Kale and Apple Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
recipes.description: A robust salad where the kale is massaged to tender perfection. Doctors recommend dark leafy greens like kale for their incredible concentration of vitamins and minerals.
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, stems removed, leaves thinly sliced
instructions: Place the sliced kale in a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt.
Using your hands, massage the kale for 2-3 minutes until it becomes darker in color and tender.
Add the apple, red onion, cranberries, and walnuts to the bowl.
In a small jar, combine lemon juice, olive oil, honey, and pepper. Shake well.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Let sit for 5-10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to absorb.

recipes.name: Baked Sweet Potato with Greek Yogurt & Chives
recipes.description: A simple, satisfying meal rich in beta-carotene and protein. A much healthier alternative to loaded baked potatoes, often suggested for weight management.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
A pinch of paprika or chili powder for garnish
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Prick the sweet potatoes all over with a fork. Place directly on the oven rack or on a baking sheet.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until very tender when pierced with a knife.
Let cool slightly. Slice each potato open lengthwise.
In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt, chives, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Top the sweet potatoes with the yogurt mixture and a sprinkle of paprika. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Classic Hummus with Vegetable Sticks
recipes.description: A creamy dip made from chickpeas and tahini, a popular recommendation for a heart-healthy snack full of fiber and healthy fats.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, rinsed and drained (liquid reserved)
2-3 tbsp aquafaba (reserved chickpea liquid) or water
For serving: Carrot sticks, cucumber sticks, bell pepper strips
instructions: In a food processor, combine the tahini and lemon juice. Process for 1 minute.
Add the olive oil, minced garlic, cumin, and a 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Process for 30 seconds.
Add the chickpeas and process for 2-3 minutes until very smooth.
While processing, slowly add 2 tablespoons of aquafaba or water until desired consistency is reached.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more salt or lemon juice if needed.
Transfer to a bowl, drizzle with a little more olive oil, and serve with fresh vegetable sticks.

recipes.name: Shakshuka (Eggs Poached in Tomato Sauce)
recipes.description: A North African dish that is a perfect balance of protein and vegetables. Frequently recommended for a nutritious, sustaining breakfast that keeps you full for hours.
ingredients: 2 tbsp fresh cilantro or parsley, chopped
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili powder. Cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in crushed tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Using a spoon, create small wells in the sauce. Crack an egg into each well.
Cover the skillet and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Garnish with fresh herbs and crumbled feta (if using). Serve immediately directly from the skillet.

recipes.name: Cucumber and Tomato Salad with Feta
recipes.description: A refreshing, hydrating salad that is a staple of the Mediterranean diet. Doctors recommend it for its high water content and array of vitamins.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, mint, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over the top.
Serve immediately or chill for 30 minutes to enhance the flavors.

recipes.name: Homemade Black Bean Burgers
recipes.description: A delicious and satisfying plant-based burger patty. These are high in fiber and protein, making them a popular choice for heart-healthy and diabetic diets.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) black beans, rinsed and drained
For serving: Whole wheat buns, lettuce, tomato, onion
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mash the black beans with a fork, leaving some whole for texture.
Add breadcrumbs, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well until combined.
Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Transfer patties to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes to firm up.
Serve on whole wheat buns with your favorite healthy toppings.

recipes.name: Brown Rice Sushi Rolls with Avocado and Cucumber
recipes.description: A fun, homemade version of sushi using nutrient-rich brown rice. A great way to incorporate whole grains and healthy fats into your diet.
ingredients: 1 cup short-grain brown rice, cooked and cooled
instructions: In a small bowl, mix rice vinegar and honey into the cooled brown rice.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
With wet hands, spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Arrange avocado, cucumber, and carrot strips in a line along the bottom edge of the rice.
Using the mat, tightly roll the sushi away from you, pressing gently as you go.
Use a sharp wet knife to slice the roll into 6-8 pieces.
Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve with low-sodium soy sauce, ginger, and wasabi.

recipes.name: Gazpacho (Chilled Tomato Soup)
recipes.description: A raw, chilled soup that is like a liquid salad. Doctors love it for its high concentration of antioxidants and vitamins from fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 2 tbsp sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar
Salt and black pepper to taste
Optional garnishes: Diced cucumber, croutons, chopped herbs
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and garlic in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
With the blender running, slowly add the olive oil and vinegar.
Add water until you reach your desired consistency.
Season generously with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a container and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Serve cold, garnished with your choice of toppings.

recipes.name: Baked Apple with Cinnamon and Walnuts
recipes.description: A simple, wholesome dessert that feels indulgent. A doctor-approved treat that provides fiber and healthy fats without refined sugars.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Core the apples, creating a well in the center, but leave the bottom intact.
In a small bowl, mix walnuts, raisins, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Stuff the mixture into the center of each apple.
Drizzle honey over the top of each apple.
Place apples in a small baking dish and pour water into the bottom of the dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the apples are tender.
Serve warm, with a spoonful of Greek yogurt if desired.

recipes.name: Turkey and Vegetable Meatballs
recipes.description: A leaner alternative to beef meatballs, using ground turkey and hidden vegetables. Often recommended for a high-protein, low-saturated-fat meal.
ingredients: 1/2 cup zucchini, grated and moisture squeezed out
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground turkey, zucchini, breadcrumbs, onion, garlic, egg, oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix gently with your hands until just combined.
Form the mixture into 1-inch meatballs.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 8-10 minutes.
Pour marinara sauce over the meatballs. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes, until meatballs are cooked through.
Serve over whole wheat pasta or zucchini noodles.

recipes.name: Zucchini Noodles (Zoodles) with Pesto
recipes.description: A brilliant low-carb, gluten-free alternative to pasta. Topped with a healthy pesto, it's a nutrient-dense meal doctors recommend for weight management.
ingredients: 1/4 cup nutritional yeast or Parmesan cheese
instructions: Make the pesto: In a food processor, combine basil, nuts, garlic, and nutritional yeast. Pulse until finely chopped.
With the processor running, slowly stream in the olive oil and lemon juice until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini noodles and sauté for 2-3 minutes, just until tender but still al dente.
Remove from heat and toss with the desired amount of pesto.
Garnish with halved cherry tomatoes and an extra sprinkle of nuts or cheese. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Quinoa Stuffed Acorn Squash
recipes.description: A beautiful and festive autumn dish. Acorn squash is rich in vitamins C and B, and quinoa provides complete protein, making this a balanced vegetarian main.
ingredients: 1 acorn squash, halved and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Brush the cut sides of the squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place cut-side down on a baking sheet.
Roast for 30-40 minutes, until tender when pierced with a fork.
Meanwhile, in a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, apple, cranberries, nuts, maple syrup, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Flip the squash halves over. Divide the quinoa stuffing between them.
Return to the oven for 10 more minutes to warm the filling.
Serve warm as a main dish.

recipes.name: Cabbage and Carrot Slaw with Apple Cider Vinaigrette
recipes.description: A crunchy, vinegar-based slaw without the heavy mayo. The apple cider vinegar is a doctor-recommended ingredient for its potential metabolic benefits.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine green cabbage, red cabbage, carrots, scallions, and parsley.
In a small jar, combine apple cider vinegar, olive oil, mustard, honey, celery seed, salt, and pepper. Shake vigorously until emulsified.
Pour the dressing over the slaw and toss well to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the cabbage to soften slightly and the flavors to meld.

recipes.name: Poached Pears in Cinnamon Tea
recipes.description: An elegant, light dessert that is naturally sweetened. Pears provide fiber, and cinnamon helps regulate blood sugar, making this a smart choice for a healthy end to a meal.
ingredients: 4 firm but ripe pears (e.g., Bosc or Anjou), peeled
4 cups strong brewed cinnamon tea (or 4 cups water with 2 cinnamon sticks)
instructions: In a saucepan just large enough to hold the pears, combine tea, lemon zest, lemon juice, honey (if using), vanilla, and cloves.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring until honey dissolves.
Add the peeled pears to the liquid. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until pears are tender when pierced with a knife.
Remove pears from the liquid and set aside.
Increase heat to high and boil the poaching liquid until it reduces and becomes slightly syrupy, about 10 minutes.
Serve pears warm or chilled, drizzled with the reduced syrup.

recipes.name: Edamame with Sea Salt
recipes.description: The simplest of snacks, edamame is a complete plant-based protein. Doctors frequently recommend it for its isoflavones and ability to help manage cholesterol.
ingredients: 10 oz (280g) package frozen edamame in pods
1 tbsp sea salt, plus more for serving
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the tablespoon of salt.
Add the frozen edamame and cook for 3-5 minutes, until bright green and tender.
Drain immediately and rinse with cool water to stop the cooking.
Sprinkle with additional sea salt and toss to coat.
Serve warm or cold. To eat, squeeze the beans out of the pods directly into your mouth.

recipes.name: Whole Wheat Pasta with Marinara and Lentils
recipes.description: A classic comfort food made healthier with whole grains and plant-based protein. The lentils add a meaty texture and a huge fiber boost, perfect for a heart-healthy diet.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
Nutritional yeast or Parmesan cheese for serving (optional)
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, oregano, and basil. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until lentils are tender and most liquid is absorbed.
Stir in the marinara sauce and cooked pasta. Heat through.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with fresh basil and a sprinkle of nutritional yeast if desired.

recipes.name: Berry and Spinach Smoothie
recipes.description: A quick and powerful breakfast or snack. The spinach is virtually undetectable but adds a massive nutrient punch. Doctors love smoothies for their digestibility and nutrient density.
ingredients: 1 cup frozen mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
1 tbsp chia seeds or ground flaxseed
1 scoop unflavored or vanilla protein powder (optional)
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender in the order listed.
Blend on high until completely smooth and creamy.
If too thick, add more almond milk one tablespoon at a time until desired consistency is reached.
Pour into a glass and drink immediately.

recipes.name: Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad
recipes.description: A beautiful salad with earthy sweetness from beets and tangy creaminess from cheese. Beets are renowned for their blood pressure-regulating nitrates.
ingredients: 3-4 medium beets, scrubbed and tops trimmed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Wrap each beet individually in foil. Place on a baking sheet and roast for 45-60 minutes, until tender when pierced with a knife.
Let beets cool. Use a paper towel to rub the skins off. Slice into wedges.
For the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, shallot, and Dijon mustard. Slowly whisk in the olive oil until emulsified. Season with salt and pepper.
Arrange greens on a platter. Top with roasted beet wedges, crumbled goat cheese, and toasted walnuts.
Drizzle with dressing and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A fantastic low-carb base for a stir-fry that is just as satisfying as regular rice. A popular recommendation from doctors for those managing diabetes or weight.
ingredients: Sliced scallions and sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the broccoli, bell pepper, and carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly tender.
Add the cauliflower rice and stir-fry for another 4-5 minutes, until tender.
Push vegetables to one side. Pour beaten eggs into the empty space and scramble until cooked, then mix into the rice.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss everything to combine.
Garnish with sliced scallions and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Miso Soup with Tofu and Wakame
recipes.description: A simple, restorative Japanese soup. Miso is a fermented food, rich in probiotics, which doctors recommend for gut health and immune function.
instructions: Place water (and kombu, if using) in a pot. Heat until just about to boil, then remove the kombu.
Place miso paste in a small bowl. Ladle a small amount of hot water into the bowl and whisk until the miso is completely dissolved.
Reduce heat to low. Add the dissolved miso, tofu, and wakame to the pot.
Gently heat for 3-4 minutes. Do not boil, as boiling destroys miso's beneficial enzymes.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with sliced scallions. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spicy Red Lentil Dip
recipes.description: A warm, creamy dip made from protein-packed red lentils. Similar to hummus but with a unique, spicy flavor. Great for a high-fiber snack with veggie sticks.
instructions: In a saucepan, combine lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until lentils are very soft and water is absorbed. Drain any excess water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet. Add onion and cook until soft and golden, about 10 minutes. Add garlic, tomato paste, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook for 1 more minute.
Combine the cooked lentils and the onion-spice mixture in a food processor.
Add lemon juice and salt. Process until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, drizzle with a little more olive oil, and garnish with parsley. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Baked Cod with a Crumbly Herb Topping
recipes.description: A light, flaky white fish with a crispy topping. Cod is an excellent source of lean protein and iodine, important for thyroid function.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat cod fillets dry and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, mix breadcrumbs, parsley, dill, garlic, and lemon zest.
Press the breadcrumb mixture evenly onto the top of each cod fillet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, until the fish is opaque and flakes easily, and the topping is golden brown.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Warm Farro Salad with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.description: Farro is an ancient whole grain with a chewy texture and nutty flavor. This hearty salad is packed with fiber and vitamins, perfect for a healthy lunch.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Combine farro and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until tender. Drain any excess liquid.
Toss eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, and onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet.
Roast vegetables for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly caramelized.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked farro and roasted vegetables.
Whisk together remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Pour over the salad and toss.
Stir in fresh basil. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Almond Butter and Banana Smoothie
recipes.description: A creamy, satisfying smoothie that tastes like a treat but is packed with nutrition. The healthy fats from almond butter provide sustained energy.
ingredients: 1 tbsp ground flaxseed or chia seeds
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.
